remarks: A bag of multipliers provides the conditions for a valid sum. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 9-Mar-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ psrbagev1 as of 18-Jul-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
psrbagev1.d $e |- D = { h e. ( NN0 ^m I ) | ( `' h " NN ) e. Fin } $.
psrbagev1.c $e |- C = ( Base ` T ) $.
psrbagev1.x $e |- .x. = ( .g ` T ) $.
psrbagev1.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` T ) $.
psrbagev1.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. CMnd ) $.
psrbagev1.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. D ) $.
psrbagev1.g $e |- ( ph -> G : I --> C ) $.
psrbagev1.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. _V ) $.
psrbagev1OLD $p |- ( ph -> ( ( B oF .x. G ) : I --> C /\ ( `' ( B oF .x. G ) " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin ) ) $.
$d B h $.
$d I h $.
